customer_message: I'm near Pitkin Ave. What kinds of items do you buy there?
agent_response: Pitkin Ave (1683 Pitkin Ave, Brooklyn, (929) 203-4646) buys and lends on gold, diamonds, watches, electronics, tools, and sneakers. Walk in with ID and the team will evaluate on the spot.

customer_message: Is the Bronx store open today?
agent_response: Bronx (1054 Southern Blvd, (929) 205-4383) is open Monday through Saturday 10am–6pm and Sunday 11am–4pm. Call if you're arriving close to closing so we can prep paperwork.

customer_message: Does the Freeport shop handle luxury watches?
agent_response: Yes. Freeport at 24 W Merrick Rd (516-844-0304) has a private appraisal booth for Rolex, AP, and Patek. Call ahead if you want a reserved slot, though walk-ins are welcome.

customer_message: How do I get to Brighton Beach store by train?
agent_response: Take the B or Q to Brighton Beach station, exit toward Brighton Beach Ave, and walk two blocks to 510 Brighton Beach Ave (718-676-6762). Look for the gold and red awning.

customer_message: Does Lawrence require appointments?
agent_response: Lawrence (636 Rockaway Turnpike, (516) 344-8433) encourages appointments for high-value items but still accepts walk-ins. Appointments guarantee access to the private appraisal office and secure parking behind the building.

customer_message: Is New Rochelle bilingual?
agent_response: Yes. The New Rochelle team at 217 North Ave (914-809-8980) serves English and Spanish speakers and regularly works with commuters from the Metro-North station one block away.

customer_message: Does the Sunset Park location take power tools?
agent_response: Yes. 4507 5th Ave (929-209-3364) handles Milwaukee, DeWalt, Makita, and more. Bring batteries and chargers so we can fully test before issuing a loan or purchase offer.

customer_message: Can I drop off in Bronx and pick up in Brighton Beach?
agent_response: Yes. Pay any interest or redemption amount at either store and we'll arrange a secure transfer. Once the item arrives at 510 Brighton Beach Ave, we call you to schedule pickup.

customer_message: Does Pitkin Ave accept walk-ins for gold testing on Sundays?
agent_response: Pitkin opens Sundays 11am–4pm for quick gold transactions. Testing is done at the counter, and you can pawn or sell in the same visit.

customer_message: Is there parking near the Freeport shop?
agent_response: Yes, there's street parking on W Merrick Rd and a municipal lot behind the store. Call (516) 844-0304 if you need curbside assistance bringing items inside.

customer_message: Does the Bronx store buy sneakers?
agent_response: Yes. Bring original boxes, receipts if available, and ensure the sneakers are clean. The Bronx team authenticates popular releases alongside jewelry and electronics.

customer_message: What number do I call for Brighton Beach questions?
agent_response: Dial (718) 676-6762 for Brighton Beach. The staff can quote estimated values, confirm hours, and set appointments for luxury watch or diamond consultations.

customer_message: Is Sunset Park good for Spanish-speaking customers?
agent_response: Absolutely. Nearly the entire 4507 5th Ave team is bilingual. They can walk you through Article 5 requirements and loan options in Spanish or English.

customer_message: Which store handles estate jewelry most often?
agent_response: Lawrence and Freeport see the most estate pieces. Lawrence has private offices for family consultations, while Freeport offers quick evaluations for commuters heading to Nassau County destinations.

customer_message: Does New Rochelle handle musical instruments?
agent_response: Yes. Bring guitars, keyboards, or brass instruments to 217 North Ave. They test electronics on-site and store instruments on padded racks so they remain gig-ready.

customer_message: Which location is closest to the beach in Brooklyn?
agent_response: Brighton Beach at 510 Brighton Beach Ave is a few steps from the boardwalk. Locals drop in before or after hitting the beach, making it perfect for quick summer loans.

customer_message: Does Pitkin Ave handle firearm loans?
agent_response: No. New York prohibits pawn loans on firearms. Pitkin focuses on jewelry, watches, electronics, sneakers, and tools in compliance with city regulations.

customer_message: Where do I go for a quick gold sale in Long Island?
agent_response: Freeport and Lawrence both serve Long Island. Freeport is ideal for South Shore commuters, while Lawrence sits right off Rockaway Turnpike with dedicated parking.

customer_message: Do any stores stay open later on Thursdays?
agent_response: Bronx and Sunset Park extend to 7pm on Thursdays to accommodate commuters. Call ahead if you need paperwork started before you arrive.

customer_message: Does Brighton Beach handle Russian-language customers?
agent_response: Yes, multiple associates speak Russian and can explain loan terms, Article 5 rules, and redemption steps in your preferred language.

customer_message: Can the Bronx store check a serial number before I visit?
agent_response: For security we verify serials in person. Bring the watch or item to 1054 Southern Blvd and we'll authenticate while you wait, logging the serial into XPawn for future reference.

customer_message: Which store is best for high-end diamonds?
agent_response: Lawrence and Brighton Beach both have GIA-trained staff on site. Lawrence offers private appointments, while Brighton Beach has gem labs for walk-in evaluations.

customer_message: Is there a number for the Sunset Park store?
agent_response: Call (929) 209-3364 for Sunset Park. They can confirm inventory, schedule layaway pickups, and answer pawn questions in English or Spanish.

customer_message: Do any locations have layaway for retail items?
agent_response: Bronx, Pitkin, and Brighton Beach all offer 90-day layaway on select retail jewelry and electronics. Bring ID and a small deposit to start the plan.

customer_message: Which store handles the most watch trades?
agent_response: Lawrence is the hub for luxury watch trades thanks to its proximity to JFK and upscale clientele. Brighton Beach is a close second, especially for Rolex sports models.

customer_message: Does New Rochelle take same-day appointments?
agent_response: Yes. Call (914) 809-8980 and the team will slot you in between walk-ins. They're used to accommodating commuters coming off the New Haven line.

customer_message: Which store is closet to JFK airport?
agent_response: Lawrence on Rockaway Turnpike is about 10 minutes from JFK, making it convenient for travelers needing quick funding before flights.

customer_message: Is there a King Gold & Pawn near Coney Island?
agent_response: Yes, Brighton Beach is the nearest location—just a short bus ride from Coney Island. They handle gold, diamonds, watches, and electronics daily.

customer_message: Do you offer curbside service for seniors in Freeport?
agent_response: Yes. Call ahead and staff will meet you outside 24 W Merrick Rd to carry items in and complete paperwork at a comfortable pace.

customer_message: Which store should I visit if I'm staying in Williamsburg?
agent_response: Pitkin Ave is closest via the A/C or L train lines, though Sunset Park is another option by bus. Both follow identical policies, so choose whichever commute is easier.
